intro: Racosperma yorkrakinense subsp. acritum, commonly known as the Yorkrakin acridum acacia, is a shrub native to northern Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought-resistant features. Its subspecies status highlights genetic differentiation from related species within the Racosperma genus. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and forage for native fauna.
